Package magellan.client.swing.preferences

Interface PreferencesAdapter

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExtendedPreferencesAdapter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdvancedRegionShapeCellRenderer.Preferences, AdvancedTextCellRenderer.ATRPreferences, BackgroundImageRenderer.BackgroundImagePreferences, BasicRegionPanel.BRPPreferences, BorderCellRenderer.Preferences, BuildingCellRenderer.BuildingCellRendererPreferences, ClientFilePreferences, ClientLookAndFeelPreferences, ClientMessagePreferences, ClientNameGeneratorPreferences, ClientPreferences, ClientTextEncodingPreferences, DesktopPreferences, DesktopShortCutPreferences, DetailedPreferencesAdapter, DetailsViewAutoCompletionPreferences, DetailsViewOrderEditorPreferences, DetailsViewPreferences, HexCellRenderer.DefaultRendererPreferencesAdapter, HighlightShapeCellRenderer.Preferences, IconColorMappingPreferences, IconPreferences, IconStyleSetPreferences, MapperPreferences, MapPreferences, MinimapPreferences, PathCellRenderer.Preferences, PluginPreferences, RegionOverviewPreferences, RegionOverviewSkillPreferences, RegionShapeCellRenderer.GeomRendererAdapter, ResourcePreferences, SignTextCellRenderer.Preferences, TaskTablePreferences, TextCellRenderer.Preferences
    public interface PreferencesAdapter
    This interface represents a component that contains preferences for one part of magellan.
    Version:
    $Revision: 269 $
    Author:
    $Author: $

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void applyPreferences()
      This function is called for applying the preferences.
      java.awt.Component getComponent()
      This function delivers the gui for the preferences adapter.
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      This function delivers the visible name of the preferences adapter.
      void initPreferences()
      This function is called for initializing the preferences.

    • Method Detail

      • initPreferences

        void initPreferences()
        This function is called for initializing the preferences. It is recommended to use this method to re-initialize the values that you set within the constructor because it is possible that there is multithread problem (see for example bug #156 in mantis).

      • applyPreferences

        void applyPreferences()
        This function is called for applying the preferences. After calling this method, the Preferences should reflect the changes made in the adapter. But not before.

      • getComponent

        java.awt.Component getComponent()
        This function delivers the gui for the preferences adapter.

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        This function delivers the visible name of the preferences adapter.
